cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 80 miles NNW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move slowly northward through the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Gulf Coast late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / eastern panhandle coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only in western Cuba at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in Florida as of Advisory 40
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida (including the Keys and southeast coast), the entire Florida Gulf Coast north to the Big Bend, and western Cuba
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (peak sustained winds generally 20-30 mph with gusts to 40 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding and dangerous surf/rip currents possible, surge heights not expected to exceed 3 ft on the Atlantic side
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1â€“2 inches expected with isolated storm-total amounts up to 20 inches leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous marine conditions and rough seas for vessels entering or leaving the port
